Description: Fragment from the shoulder of a closed pottery vessel, painted. To the right, head, neck and back of ibex with horn, looking back to left; to the right egde, a vertical line, perhaps marking the edge of a framed scene. Light brown, with fine mica; black and white inclusions; Munsell 7.5YR 6/3 (light brown).
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18
Curator's comments: BM register records 1888,0208.139.a-d - four fragments of rough vases with decoration of ibexes, head in outline, no incision lines, plus 18 fragments 1888,0208.139.e-g of grey-ware vases. Compare with fragments of a neck-amphora from Mendes (Schlotzhauer & Weber, Men. 4-5). Also compare with a fragment from a neck-amphora or Oinochoe from Naukratis (Alexandria, Inv. 9476, Venit 1988, 7 Nr. 11 Abb. S 138 Pl.3
The Findspot number '18' has been scratched inside. A 725 a pencilled.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 57, II. 2)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 97)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p.57 fig.7, Table 1)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.210)
